message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DM, cs.SY, cs.NE 

The paper deals with optimization and exploration in a network, which is a common topic in machine learning and artificial intelligence. The use of randomized shortest-paths and Markov decision problems suggests a focus on reinforcement learning and decision making, which are often found in the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). The use of Lagrangian duality and iterative procedures suggests a focus on optimization and algorithms, which are often found in the sub-categories of cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) and cs.SY (Systems and Control).
